metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6976 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: libvips before 8.7.4 generates output images from uninitialized memory locations when processing corrupted input image data because iofuncs/memory.c does not zero out allocated memory. This can result in leaking raw process memory contents through the output image.

criterions.comment: vips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
